abstract: Irish police officer killed while responding to domestic dispute becomes only second officer to be fatally shot since 2001 in country where policemen do not carry firearms.
lead_paragraph: There has been only one other fatal shooting of a police officer in the last 14 years in a country where most officers do not carry firearms.

headline.print_headline: Europe; Ireland: Police Officer Is Fatally Shot in County Louth

snippet: There has been only one other fatal shooting of a police officer in the last 14 years in a country where most officers do not carry firearms.
